intro: Blepharocalyx suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented waxtree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its native habitat. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant aroma. The bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their potential therapeutic properties.
